Ca Phe Muoi
1 cup coffee, with milk and sugar if desired 6 tablespoons heavy cream 2 tablespoons sugar ½ teaspoon kosher salt ½ cup milk 2 tablespoons cocoa powder ice

Chill coffee in the refrigerator until ready to use. In a tall cup, add in the heavy cream, sugar, and salt. Whisk together with a mini whisk or electric frother until thick. Fill a chilled glass with ice. Pour in the ⅓ cup of milk, the chilled brewed coffee, and top with as much salted cream as you’d like! Dust with cocoa powder for garnish. Enjoy!
The Cracked Coffee Latte
1 cup milk of choice 2 shots espresso 1 tablespoon syrup or sweetener of choice ⅓ cup dark or milk chocolate ice cube

Melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second increments, stirring in between each time until fully melted. Pour the melted chocolate into a clear plastic cup, and coat the inside. Allow any excess to drip back into the bowl. Freeze the cup for about 10 minutes to set the chocolate. Assemble the drink: Fill the chocolate-coated cup to the top with ice cubes. Then pour in the sweetener, followed by the milk and freshly brewed espresso. Gently squeeze the cup to crack the chocolate mold, then give the drink a stir. Enjoy!
Cafecito De Olla
6 cups water(1.4 L) ½ cup coffee grounds(60 g) 120 g piloncillo(120 g) 2 whole cinnamon sticks 2 whole star anise pods 5 whole cloves

In a medium pot, bring the water to a simmer over medium-low heat. Add the coffee grounds and piloncillo and stir for 2 minutes to dissolve the piloncillo. Add the cinnamon sticks, star anise pods, and cloves, and stir for 1 minute. Cover the pot and let the coffee simmer for 10 minutes. Strain the coffee and serve immediately. Enjoy!
Honey Almond Milk Flat White
1 shot espresso or strongly brewed coffee 2 teaspoons honey ½ cup almond milk Cinnamon for garnish

Add the espresso and honey to your desired mug and stir to combine. Froth the almond milk. See recipe notes for various frothing methods. Pour frothed almond milk over the espresso, garnish with a pinch of cinnamon, and serve immediately.
Pumpkin Spice Coffee

1 cup brewed coffee(240 mL) 1 cup almond milk(240 mL) 2 tablespoons pumpkin puree 2 tablespoons maple syrup, or sweetener of choice ¼ teaspoon vanilla extract ½ teaspoon pumpkin pie spice, or ¼ teaspoon cinnamon plus ¼ teaspoon nutmeg whipped cream, optional
Combine all ingredients in a medium sauce pot and heat through, making sure not to boil, stirring occasionally. Serve hot, or over ice! Top with whipped cream (optional). Enjoy!
Whipped Coffee
2 tablespoons hot water(28 g) 2 tablespoons sugar(24 g) 2 tablespoons instant coffee powder(12 g) milk, to serve ice, to serve

Add the hot water, sugar, and instant coffee to a bowl. Either hand whisk or use an electric mixer until the mixture is fluffy and light. To serve, spoon a dollop over a cup of milk with ice in it and stir. Enjoy!
Cold Brew With Sweet And Salty Foam

Cold Brew: 6 cups water(1.4 L), plus more as needed 2 cups coffee grounds(220 g)
Caramel Simple Syrup: ½ cup granulated sugar(100 g) ¼ cup water(60 mL), plus 2 tablespoons, divided
Sweet Salty Cold Foam: ½ cup whole milk(120 mL) ½ cup heavy cream(120 mL) 2 tablespoons granulated sugar ¼ teaspoon salt ice, for serving

Make the cold brew: Combine the water and coffee grounds in a large container. Stir until all of the grounds are wet. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Make the caramel simple syrup: Add the sugar and 2 tablespoons water to a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook until the sugar is completely dissolved, about 3 minutes. Increase the heat to medium and cook, without disturbing for about 5 minutes, until the mixture is caramel-colored. Remove the pot from the heat. Carefully pour in the remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) water and stir to incorporate. Transfer the syrup to a heat-proof container, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use. Line a fine-mesh sieve with a coffee filter and set over a large bowl. Pour the cold brew through the strainer and let drain. You may need to pour in batches so the strainer does not overflow. Return the strained cold brew to a clean container. If the coffee is too strong, dilute with more water to taste. Refrigerate the cold brew until ready to use. Make the cold foam: In a medium bowl, combine the milk, cream, sugar, and salt. Whip with an immersion blender or electric hand mixer on high speed until foamy, 2–4 minutes. To assemble, fill 2 large glasses with ice. Pour 1 cup (240 ml) cold brew coffee into each glass. Stir about 2 tablespoons of the caramel syrup into each glass. Top with the cold foam. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
Vietnamese Coffee
1 tablespoon ground chicory coffee 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk 1 cup hot water(240 mL)

Pour the ground coffee into a Vietnamese phin filter base. Place the phin filter strainer on top of the coffee. Pour the sweetened condensed milk into a glass. Place the phin assembly on top of the glass. Pour hot water into the phin filter. Place the phin filter lid on top and let the coffee drip through the filter into the glass. Stir well before serving. Enjoy!
Snickers-Inspired Latte

1 cup skim milk(240 mL) 1 cup sugar(200 g) ½ cup creamy peanut butter(120 g) 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ⅛ teaspoon kosher salt 1 cup whole milk(240 mL), frothed 4 oz brewed espresso(115 mL) whipped cream, for topping caramel syrup, for topping chocolate syrup, for topping crushed peanut, for topping crushed nougat, for topping

In a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the skim milk, sugar, peanut butter, and vanilla. Bring to a low simmer, whisking constantly, until the sugar has dissolved and the syrup is smooth and thick, 3–5 minutes. Add the salt, then remove the pot from the heat and let the syrup cool for 10–15 minutes, until thickened slightly. Leftover syrup will keep in an airtight container the refrigerator for up to 1 month. Drizzle the peanut butter syrup around the inside rim of a large mug. Add the espresso and frothed whole milk. Top with whipped cream, caramel syrup, chocolate syrup, crushed peanuts, and crushed nougat. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
Peanut Butter Espresso Martini
1 teaspoon creamy peanut butter 1 cup ice 1 ½ oz Skrewball® Peanut Butter Whiskey ½ oz coffee liqueur 1 ½ oz freshly brewed espresso 3 espresso beans, for garnish smoked sea salt, for garnish

Warm the peanut butter until it is loose enough to drizzle, then drizzle around the inside of a martini or coupe glass. In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the Skrewball® Peanut Butter Whiskey, coffee liqueur, and espresso and shake vigorously for 1 minute. Strain the cocktail into the martini glass. Place the espresso beans in the center and finish with a pinch of smoked sea salt. Enjoy!
Java Chip Caffeinated Smoothie
1 ½ cups coffee(360 mL), brewed, cooled ½ cup half and half(120 mL) ⅓ cup chocolate chips(60 g), plus more, crushed for topping 2 tablespoons sugar 6 coffee beans whipped cream, for topping

Pour the coffee into an ice cube tray. Freeze for at least 4 hours, or overnight. Add the coffee ice cubes, half and half, chocolate chips, sugar, and coffee beans to a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and top with whipped cream and crushed chocolate chips. Enjoy!
3 Musketeers-Inspired Marshmallow Macchiato
1 cup whole milk(240 mL) 8 marshmallows 4 oz brewed espresso(110 mL) Chocolate whipped cream, for topping chocolate syrup, for topping Red and Blue Sprinkle Special Equipment, Espresso Machine

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk and marshmallows and bring to a low simmer, stirring until the marshmallows melt, 3–5 minutes. Pour the milk mixture into a large mug, along with the espresso. Top with chocolate whipped cream, chocolate syrup, and red and blue sprinkles. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
Twix Frappuccino Copycat

2 tablespoons simple syrup 1 tablespoon toffee syrup 2 tablespoons caramel syrup, plus more for serving 1 tablespoon hazelnut syrup 2 oz espresso(60 mL) ¾ cup whole milk(180 mL) 1 tablespoon chocolate chips 1 ½ cups ice(210 g) 1 tablespoon whipped cream, plus more for topping chocolate syrup, for serving

In a blender, combine the simple syrup, toffee syrup, caramel syrup, hazelnut syrup, espresso, milk, chocolate chips, ice, and 1 tablespoon whipped cream. Blend until smooth. Drizzle caramel syrup and chocolate syrup down the sides of a 20-ounce glass. Pour in the Frappuccino. Top with whipped cream and more caramel and chocolate syrup. Enjoy!
Frozen Irish Coffee
2 cups strong black coffee(470 g), cooled 1 ½ cups sweetened cream(355 mL) 3 oz irish whiskey(90 mL) 1 bar chocolate, melted

Pour coffee into ice molds and freeze. Pour sweetened cream into ice molds and freeze. Whip the remaining sweetened cream and set aside. Take 4 cubes of frozen coffee and place in a blender, add 1.5 oz whiskey and blend until foamy. Add 2 cubes of frozen sweetened cream and 1 tablespoon of chocolate, blend. Top with whip cream and drizzle with more chocolate. Enjoy!
